title.rendered: “IDF Strikes Hezbollah Targets in Southern Lebanon: A Detailed Overview of Recent Anti-Terrorist Operations”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

The IDF struck targets of the Hezbollah terrorist organization in various areas in southern Lebanon; a circle closed in a building in which a terrorist operative was identified by observation

A short while ago, fighters struck Hezbollah terrorist infrastructures in the area of ​​the village of Al-Dahira in southern Lebanon.

Yesterday (Sunday), a visual intelligence analyst in Unit 869 identified the entry of a terrorist operative into a military building of Hezbollah in the Aita al-Shaab area. Immediately after the identification, a report was transferred to the Fire Center in the Northern Command and combat aircrafts were launched that attacked the building hosting the operative shortly afterwards.

In the past day, a launch site of the organization in the Itarun area was attacked alongside a terrorist infrastructure in the Al-Adaisa area, and artillery fire was carried out to other areas in Lebanon.

Additionally, this morning, remains of an aircraft were found in an open area in the Arbel area of the Lower Galilee. It doesn’t seem to be an IDF aircraft. The circumstances of the event are under investigation, IDF and Israeli police forces are at the scene.

Attached is documentation from the attacks: https://bit.ly/4bFEkSW.
